multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: labor; 22,000 tech layoffs in 2025 will push up US unemployment claims and depress services PMI.

category.motivation: The article provides analysis of tech layoffs trend and its impact on innovation, which is a market commentary.

impact.motivation: No node was provided to map the article to a specific market handle or catalyst, so relevance cannot be determined.

time_frame.motivation: The article highlights a structural shift in tech employment driven by AI and automation, indicating a long-term trend.

article_node.title: A comprehensive list of 2025 tech layoffs
article_node.summary: The article compiles a detailed list of tech layoffs in 2025, noting over 22,000 job cuts across 549 companies, with a peak of 16,084 layoffs in February alone. It highlights the broader trend of companies scaling back as they adopt AI and automation, and underscores the human impact of these reductions. The tracker serves as a resource for monitoring the trajectory of cutbacks and their effect on innovation across the tech sector.
